sub_title: Founder & Chair, StatWeather | Chief Scientific Officer, NatureAlpha | Global AI Ambassador, SwissCognitive
summary:
★ Founder of StatWeather, recognized in 2018 as the #1 Climate Technology Globally by Environmental Business International, 2015 Top Data Provider Globally through Energy Risk Awards, Top U.S. Weather Company in Energy Risk Software Rankings 2013, Best Newcomer of the Year 2013, a 2014 S&P Platts Global Energy Awards "Rising Star", and in the Top 5 Most Innovative Companies in America through MeetAdvisor

★ Inventor of 90-Day Ahead Weather Forecast that predicts extreme events with bulls-eye accuracy, as documented by Forbes, Reuters, Energy Manager Today, and others

★ Named International Woman of the Year by Renewable Energy World and Power Engineering and a "Lifetime Achievement" Leader through S&P Platts Global Energy Awards

★ Keynote and invited speaker for major engagements, including creator and moderator of CNNMoney Switzerland Digital Future Board Room, EU Climate Research & Innovation Days, ClimateCon, Women in Innovation, Commodity Markets Council (CMC), Commodity Trading Risk Management (CTRM), Energy Risk USA, The Money Show, Energy Weather Summit, LDC Gas Forum, Financial Certainty to Move Mexico, Total Energy USA, The Climate Resilient Grid, Google Startup Grind, ASEAN Science Diplomats, TechPark Davos during the World Economic Forum, Blockchain Economic Forum (Davos), and others

★ Author of #1 Most Viewed Energy Blog on Energy Central, "Exactly How Accurate Are Weather Forecasts?", key contributor to Harvard Veritas column for The Manila Times on Leadership and Scientific Commercialization, and Chief Editor of Digital Future Magazine containing thought leadership in digital innovation

★ Subject Matter Expert with 25+ Years' Experience in Emerging Technology and Mathematical Methods: Pioneer in Artificial Intelligence, Cutting-edge Forecasting Models, Climatology, Space Physics, Geospace, and Scientific Communication

★ R&D in Space Physics and Aerospace at Lawrence Livermore National Labs, Institute for Advanced Study (Princeton), NASA Johnson Space Center, US Air Force, US Navy, Lockheed Martin, General Dynamics, L3Harris, Honeywell Aerospace
